description: From Middle English discernen, from Old French discerner, from Latin discernere (“to separate, divide, distinguish, discern”), from dis- (“apart”) + cernere (“to separate”); see certain.

verbs.description: discern (third-person singular simple present discerns, present participle discerning, simple past and past participle discerned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To detect with the senses, especially with the eyes.
(transitive) To perceive, recognize, or comprehend with the mind; to descry.
(transitive) To distinguish something as being different from something else; to differentiate.
examples: He was too young to discern right from wrong.
